column2: What are the differences between hard disk drives and solid state disks? (Choose two.)
column3: A. Hard disks have a motor and moving parts, solid state disks do not. | E. Solid state disks provide faster access to stored data than hard disks.
column6: B. Hard disks can fail due to physical damage, while solid state disks cannot fail. | C. Solid state disks can store many times as much data as hard disk drives. | D. /dev/sda is a hard disk device while /dev/ssda is a solid state disk.

column2: Reverse DNS assigns hostnames to IP addresses. How is the name of the IP address 198.51.100.165 stored on a DNS server?
column3: B. In the RNAME record for 198-51-100-165.rev.arpa.
column6: A. In the A record for 165.100.51.198.ipv4.arpa. | C. In the ARPA record for 165.100.51.198.rev. | D. In the REV record for arpa.in-addr.198.51.100.165.

column2: What information can be displayed by top?
column3: B. Running processes, ordered by CPU or RAM consumption.
column6: A. Existing files, ordered by their size. | C. User accounts, ordered by the number of logins. | D. User groups, ordered by the number of members. | E. User accounts, ordered by the number of files.

column2: Which of the following commands can be used to resolve a DNS name to an IP address?
column6: A. dnsname | B. dns | C. query | E. iplookup

column3: E. total used free shared buff/cache available  Mem: 16123128 12565680 2011624 412128 1545824 7180416
